VLIB_L1DistanceS16

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_L1DistanceS16 (const int16_t *restrict X, const int16_t *restrict Y, int32_t d, uint32_t *restrict L1D)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_L1DistanceS16 ( const int16_t *restrict  X,
const int16_t *restrict  Y,
int32_t  d,
uint32_t *restrict  L1D 
)

Description
This function accepts as input two vectors, p and q, of size N. It returns the L1 distance, L1D, between p and q as a 32-bit unsigned integer as in the following equation: 
          N
    L1D = a min[ (2^15  - 1) , |pi - qi|]
          i=1
Parameters:
[in] *X Pointer to array containing first vector (SQ15.0)
[in] *Y Pointer to array containing second vector (SQ15.0)
[in] d Number of elements in each vector (SQ32.0)
[out] *L1D Pointer to variable to store the computed L1 Distance (UQ32.0)
Assumptions
  • All arrays should be double-word aligned.
  • There should be a minimum of four elements in X and Y.
  • If the absolute difference between two corresponding vector elements is greater than 2^15-1, then that particular value is saturated to 2^15-1.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
